parameters.name: membershipIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier for a membership resource.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the analysis template.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the analysis template.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The information in the analysis template. Currently supports text, the query text for the analysis template. text (string) --- The query text. artifacts (dict) --- The artifacts of the analysis source. The entry point for the analysis template artifacts. The artifact location. The bucket name. The object key. additionalArtifacts (list) --- Additional artifacts for the analysis template. (dict) --- The analysis template artifact. The role ARN for the analysis template artifacts.

nested_params.name: artifacts
nested_params.description: The artifacts of the analysis source.

nested_params.name: entryPoint
nested_params.description: The entry point for the analysis template artifacts.

nested_params.name: additionalArtifacts
nested_params.description: Additional artifacts for the analysis template.

nested_params.name: roleArn
nested_params.description: The role ARN for the analysis template artifacts.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: An optional label that you can assign to a resource when you create it. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. When you use tagging, you can also use tag-based access control in IAM policies to control access to this resource. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: analysisParameters
parameters.description: The parameters of the analysis template. (dict) --- Optional. The member who can query can provide this placeholder for a literal data value in an analysis template. The name of the parameter. The name must use only alphanumeric, underscore (_), or hyphen (-) characters but cannot start or end with a hyphen. The type of parameter. defaultValue (string) --- Optional. The default value that is applied in the analysis template. The member who can query can override this value in the query editor.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the parameter. The name must use only alphanumeric, underscore (_), or hyphen (-) characters but cannot start or end with a hyphen.

nested_params.name: defaultValue
nested_params.description: Optional. The default value that is applied in the analysis template. The member who can query can override this value in the query editor.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: A relation within an analysis. referencedTables (list) --- The tables referenced in the analysis schema. (string) ---
